place.name: BRANDON PARVA
place.gazetteerText: BRANDON (Little), or Brandon-Parva, a parish in Forehoe district, Norfolk; on the river Yare, 2 miles NNE of Hardingham r. station, and 5 N W by N of Wymondham. Post Town, Wymondham. Acres, 979. Real property, £1,886. Pop., 208. Houses, 44. The property is subdivided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £281. Patron, Isaac Preston, Esq. The church was restored in 1861. An endowed school has £12; and other charities, £13. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
